tags: Value for money,
review: Everything Was Good but For report Checking They took 800rs which was not at valued for 2 min conversation ur charging so much very Disappointed
reply_text:
That is standard fees of any specialist doctor.
 Showing reports discussing treatment on reports is part of consultation. If there were any doubts doctor would have explained you for more time. 

You were informed fees of doctor prior to consultation neither the consultation nor fees were enforced. We are not charitable setup but we do consider our poor needy patients if they request us.
You will always get right guidance at our clinic that's what we can assure you.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
I first met Dr. Shubashree Patil few years ago, when my dad who suffers from diabetes, had a foot wound that got infected badly and needed surgery. Surgery and post surgery convalescence can be an extremely trying and stressful time for both patients and their families.And Dr. Patil was there for us each step of the way.
She has been treating my dad‚Äôs diabetes and is our family physician ever since.
*** ** * ************* *** **** ******* *** **** **** ***** she is understanding and very approachable. She takes the time to really listen, understand our concerns and offers detailed explainations to allay any fears or doubts.

She takes genuine interest in the health & well being of her patients. This makes me confident that my dad‚Äôs health is in good hands. I especially appreciate the effort she takes through her various initiatives to involve and educate the families as well, which is really important in managing a lifestyle ailment like diabetes. Her expertise and her empathy is deeply appreciated.
reply_text:
Many thanks Hannu üôè!! I am humbled 
Take good care.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
To start with I found out about her online. Seems like she has a high reputation as a diabetologist and we experienced why. 

This doctor is one if those that induce confidence in her patients. Her professionalism, to the point talks and her willingness to listen to her patient is what I feel other doctors should learn from her. She's quite tech savvy too it seems as she's availaible for online consultation, video consultation and her appointments r immediately confirmed via a msg from practo.
We were quite you can say scared in the family for my father as his HBa1c turned out to be 16+ in his annual report. Which was at critical levels (this happened because of him completely going off allopathic medicines and relying completely on ayurvedic medicines)
He's a type 2 chronic diabetic (having it for over 15 yrs) and he has never been on insulin but here there was no other option but to take up insulin.
It was our first time knowing and understanding about insulin. And her to the point consultation and her encouragement to take up insulin without anyone's help really boosted my father's confidence (mine too). 

Lastly I would have given 5 stars (if there had been star system on practo) because she did not deviate from topic (she didn't go on a ranting spree on how Ayurveda is not so good)
She stuck to what was important and she gave a good 40mins to us.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,

tags: Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Doctor friendliness,
review:
I was quite happy and fully satisfied with the treatment for  Type -2 diabetic .
Iam a diabetic patient for the last20 years and recently sugar was above 250 level.
Iam from Nasik .I came across with this doctor during our Srilanken tour in Dec 2019.
Since about 2 months back when my sugar level went up beyond control ,we remembered Dr.Subhashree Patil and consulted her .After two months of treatment my sugar level has come down to normal . 
I have no hesitation in recommending her for any chronic diabetic disorder. She is very friendly ,polite and explains to patients very nicely .
God bless.

My experience was wonderful, I found doctor very Caring, attentive, understanding and she is very much concerned about her patients .         I appreciate Dr Shubhashree's way of making patient comfortable so that they can reveal each and every trouble or problems they are facing which will help her in diagnosing the causes. She listened respectfully and guided us to Dietary changes and good life style practices. She has helped me so much with my diabetes management and treatment.

Thank you so much for providing me with excellent medical care which helped me to come out of a tough time with my health issues.

Salute to your Knowledge and skills, God Bless You.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
Uncontrollable glucose count for past 10 years. Changed many Dr 's. Then sometime back chanced this Dr. Subhashree Patil- opp. Holy spirit hospital clinic from Practo.  Very pleasant and professional approach. Took time to understand the case. Explained that 80% remedy lies on Dietary modifications.  Rest on excersise & very little on medication.  Very convincing.  Ritually obeyed her dietary recommendations.  Believe or not in 15 days my readings are close to normal. Fasting 79 & PP 160.  Hb1ac reduced by 2%.  She assures a near normal result in next 45 days. Very hopeful. 
I very strongly recommend this Dr. Subashree Patil. 
Trust me, this is not a motivated or nudged narration of my opinion or Review.  100% from heart.  Go for her.. Wishing you all a faster cure. 
Parvathy.
reply_text: Thank you mrs Kanan! Glad to be of help

tags: Wait time,
review: waited there for more than an hour but I was not able to meet the doctor. finally left without seeing the doc. waiting time is above one hour in the clinic. not sure about the doctor because didn't get a chance to meet her. but management is bad.
reply_text:
Dear madam, 
Your appointment was booked 45 min prior at short notice online for 7.45pm but our clinic is functional from 6 pm onwards hence patients other than practo were already in queue .
If you could have given a confirmation call understanding short notice we would have refused but my reception still tried to accommodate you. 
If your symptoms were bothersome we could have given preference and taken you but you left without informing at reception although my staff  called you up many times phone calls were not answered.
Sorry for your experience we tried to do our best.

tags: Explanation of the health issue,Wait time,
review: Detail guidance is provided.  Very helpful, BP machine is also provided for 10 days.  One request, it should come with out charges, since it is taken on returnable basis.
reply_text: Many thanks for your kind words!! It encourages us .We charge only rps 200 for 15 days usage of  BP instrument but it gives our patient liberty to monitor at comfort of home innumerable times and ensures BP control benefit to patient with precision  also it imbibies habit of self monitoring and prevents unnecessary dose escalation which our doctor is very perticuler about .This miniscule amount takes care for the wear tear and battery replacements and other servicing needed for the machine (at times we have recieved our machine in irreparable conditions too).
